SENT.plain: Angiographically occult vascular malformations (AOVM) are cerebrovascular malformations that are not demonstrable on cerebral angiography
The majority of AOVMs located in the third ventricle are cavernous malformations
To the best of our knowledge an angiographically occult arteriovenous malformation (AOAVM) of the third ventricle has not been previously reported
We report an unusual vascular malformation of the third ventricle presenting with hydrocephalus due to mass effect, verified histopathologically as an AOAVM
